section_purpose: Introduces the NeuroBack framework that uses offline GNN predictions on variable phases to enhance phase selection in CDCL SAT solvers, aiming to reduce computational cost and improve effectiveness.
key_points: NeuroBack employs offline model predictions to reduce computational cost and make CDCL SAT solving more effective.
It converts input CNF formulas into a compact and learnable graph representation.
A GNN model predicts the phases of backbone variables.
Model inference is performed only once before SAT solving and used as initialization.
The enhanced SAT solver outputs the satisfiability of the input CNF formula.

architectures: GNN model for predicting phases of backbone variables (detailed in subsections)

dependencies: Section 2 BACKGROUND for CDCL SAT solving concepts
Section 3 RELATED WORK for GNN context
reproducibility_notes: GNN model design and training from 4.2
Application of phase predictions in SAT solvers from 4.3
